description: Located in Toronto, Canada, Cheese Boutique has been providing the city with succulent selections of cheese, meat, catering, dessert and fresh food for 3 generations since 1970. Transforming something good into something great is what we believe in.

reviews.title: Owner/employees threaten assault to seniors, shouting banging on car.
text: One of the owners’ relatives enraged and shouting nonstop follows me out of the store joined by another employee shouting. This was at 4PM on October 30th.

The owner relative banged on the car, shouting at me and my wife and threatened to punch me out. We are in our 80’s and a lot smaller than these two big thugs. I never raised my voice at all and did nothing that could possibly justify this. I wrote the manager, Afrim, no reply so far. I had been discussing a change to their baguette recipe. Despite my mild, friendly manner he claimed to take offence at something and started the shouting which never stopped. The other employee joined in the shouting and said here’s an insult:“you’re old.” And gave me the finger.

We have been loyal customers for close to 40 years. Spending lots of money and friendly with the staff and the owners relatives who own the place. We have praised it to many friends. The owners relative knew this, and I reminded him anyway, pleading with him to stop the attack on the car and threatening to hit me.
My wife and I never even raised our voices at any time in all this and stayed extremely polite.
I’m still feeling very shaken by this.
Seniors beware of Cheese Boutique!

reviews.title: Great store, could have better manners.
text: Love the store, lived up to expectations. Spent way too much but happy with purchases.
Would have rated a 5 except for walking by Afrim Pristine and saying hello and he did not even respond, despite looking directly at me.  Very disappointed, did not expect this at all.

reviews.title: The original Eataly !
text: The Cheese boutique has been our neighborhood up scale grocery for 20 years now. Fresh high quality produce from mainly Europe, with a emphasis on Italian supply. They have a wine cellar as well but I have not checked it out well enough to comment here. The deserts are definitely excellent. The cheese collection is top, as you might expect under the name. Like Eataly, the prices are over the top. It's not a regular grocery shopping destination for me although it's just next door.
For an occasional treat, go ahead!

reviews.title: Great cheese store
text: Great cheese store, they also have produce, meat, deli meat, and a varietà of international and local products. I love that they sell imported authentic tortellini. The brie was great and the stracchino was a pleasant surprise. Love the products they make themselves, including the cheese!

reviews.title: Average grocery with high prices
text: Second visit on this store. They have a big array and variety of cheese, some you can see are dry on edges and mold where there should not be any. Vegetable and fruits are priced higher that McEwen, Pusateri and the like. Big choice of chocolates, some I have seen I. Europe but check the expiry dates. The bakery, pricey for each piece like the cruffin, bomba, biscotti, Nutella doughnuts and cannoli are not all fresh, you have to ask them if it is and they take their time answering you. The  sfogliatella definitely was days old with the ricotta really smelly...pricey but they should not sell day old or 2 days cannoli i definitely was not fresh also. Had the sandwich which was average.  This is the second time I came for pastries, nothing special by the way.
The problem with this store is that there is no expiry dates on some products so you do not know how long it has been sitting there Thought expiry dates were required for food products inOntario.
Secondly some items are not priced, you have to ask some person for the price...which is a pain. It really should be stamped for posted.
I like to  know what I am paying for and not ask per item...the food truck outside was closed...

reviews.title: Food Heaven
text: Spend your money here and enjoy everything they offer! This includes cheeses, meat, produce, baked goods and caviar. OMG break my bank and go to food heaven.

reviews.title: Fantastic service
text: I remember visiting CB when I was a kid with my dad. He was my first foodie inspiration and cheese lover.
Years later I am just a inspired as I was as a child.

The service was fantastic! A greeting with a smile from every staff you encountered. The knowledge and explanation of every product was executed timely and professionally. A high standard of costumer service was the norm. Some things never change.

The vast amount of beautiful products awakened my sleeping culinary memoirs. Some of the best if the best. I found high quality products from special vacations we had. A gorgeously cured sausage from France we had on a visit in Mach last year. I was ecstatic to find it. We picked up several other items and headed to to bakery, my husbands candy  area. We purchased a cake and sadly had to leave. Honestly I could have spent the entire day enjoying so many wonderful finds.
Yes and great pic of one of our mentors, and a second wonderful memory.

reviews.title: spend way too much money here
text: Super selection of cheeses and high end food stuff for your gourmet table. Be cautious I have found mold on some cold case products fridges are not cold enough. Sadly they don't carry Echire butter anymore 50% of the reason I went there. Prices are high so not for things you can get elsewhere. Limited parking, high staff turnover for some reason, some are not friendly or helpful. Tall girl is very knowledgeable about cheese they call her the cheese maven.

reviews.title: Thank god not closer I would go broke
text: We love our cheese, and we loved this place.  Knowledgeable staff, we tried many cheeses.  We bought exactly what we wanted.  Crazy amounts of cheese, plus, so many other things ...sauces, balsamics, meats,..and a free espresso while browsing.

I bought a crazy costly steak.  I probably should have done a better job cooking it.  Some pastries were great, but the cheeses were the best.  They had a balsamic for sale that was $2500!  Crazy!  I bought some syuffed olives, some small desserts and cheese, the meat  I bought was crazy expnsive,.... you have to know your meats here. .   I will come back

reviews.title: Amazing
text: The best selection of cheeses and meats. Great service. Your go-to place for hard to find ingredients. So happy to have this place near our home!

reviews.title: A Must Stop anytime you are entertaining
text: Cheese boutique is so much more than a cheese store. It offers a wide variety of quality products for your feast or everyday meal. The bakery items are scrumptious. There is a small produce and butchery. There is also a large array of condiments, sauces and pastas. Today I picked up some lovely lamb and a selection of cheeses. Love love love The Cheese Boutique. Stop in - try the gelati on your first visit.

reviews.title: Simply awesome
text: Place is perfect, amazing selection good prices.  Always packed....for a reason.  Gelato is best I've ever had.  I would recommend this place to everyone.

reviews.title: Loved my visit
text: Great find and experience
Will return when in the neighbourhood
A must see as it has many treasures
Wild variety of products from meat to cheese to vegetable sweets cookware breads  just absolutely amazing.

reviews.title: Yummmmmm
text: I've been wanting to go here since I saw it on breakfast television a long few months ago. We finally go went this past Monday. Wasn't busy so we had lots of time to explore.  They have everything there!!
In store made cheeses, deli meats, pastries, jams jellies mustards etc etc.  There's something for everyone there and it was all delicious

reviews.title: Love this place!!
text: Always able to find an amazing selection of cheeses and the pastries are fantastic...can't leave without picking up something!!  Staff are so helpful and super nice-it doesn't feel like a store.  It's almost like a dinner party but not in your house!!  You will never be disappointed!

reviews.title: In the middle of nowhere an awsome food boutique awaits.
text: My friends know I love food and so they took me to this wonderful boutique cheese/deli store.  The store is packed to the gills with delightful items, every kind of oil and vinegar you could imagine. Tea, condiments, hot sauces, crackers, candy, baked items, pasta sauces and tomato goods to make your own. Pasta, rice, and many gluten free finds as well. The deli area was a treasure trove and you can try the cheese before you purchase. Even bird seed and BBQ supplies.  I was very pleased with the selections I purchased and the deli pepperettes are dry and tasty just the way I like them.  A must try for any foodie. Just off The Queensway exit from QEW.

reviews.title: Delicious surprise
text: First time to the cheese boutique and made the trip from Whitby (which is on the other side of the world ), but well worth the drive. Great variety, good quality, and extremely tasty. In the end, it's all about the flavour. Bought bread,meat, and cheese ( of course). All very good. Probably considered a little pricey, but, good tasty stuff usually is.
I am already trying to figure out when I can get back there.

reviews.title: Uncharacterizable. Truly unique. Must see.
text: Even though you can eat deliciously here it's not a restaurant.
You can shop for all the ingredients for a six course Italian / French / American dinner party but I wouldn't call this place a supermarket.
It's simply unique among food purveyors.
The selections and variety are truly spectacular. I could have spent a full day here just looking.
On top of that the staff are knowledgeable, friendly, cheerful patient and happy to assist.

Even down to the parking lot attendant who saw me struggle to get out of the car, I've hurt my back a few days ago in NY, he kindly pulled me out and helped me stand up. All while smiling warmly despite the chilly Toronto breeze that my friends were describing as mild. Bloody chilly in my mind.

I bought Irish Tea ( Barry's) Irish Cheese ( Cashel Blue ) French made strong Dijon mustard , a box of licorice allsorts, and a ham and cheese baguette. There is no describing the variety it's fantastic.
This will be a regular Toronto stop from now on.

reviews.title: Astounding amount of variety!
text: Going in through the entrance during the holidays at The Cheese Boutique is magical.  The variety of foods, sauces, deli  meats, baking, and cheeses is astounding!  It's a destination that needs to be experienced.

reviews.title: A cornerstone of Toronto culture
text: During a recent visit home, I showed my UK family some of the sights around Toronto. The Cheese Boutique could not be missed! As previous reviewers have said, the amount of choice in food here is almost limitless! Upstairs they have a good selection of high quality kitchen accessories, from napkins to pepper mills, knives to electric mixers. The prices are not cheap but they are fair for the quality and service you get. You can easily spend $100 in a blink of an eye. A must see if visiting Toronto and a great place to regularly visit if you're a native Torontonian.

reviews.title: THE BEST in the city!
text: This is a 10 Star cheese and gastronomic destination. If you go during the week, you may see some of the top chefs in Toronto shopping and chatting with Afrim, Cheese Sommelier extraordinaire.

reviews.title: An Emporium of Gastronomic Delights!
text: A good friend introduced me to this emporium of gastronomic delights that bring you back for more. It definitely did for me as this was my second visit. I had no idea this place existed but I am so happy I do now.

Do not let the location of the exterior of the boutique fool you: The selection of unique cheeses and cold cuts is incredible and the tastes you will discover even better. For me the pecorino cheese infused with truffle is sublime and the 18 month aged San Daniele prosciutto along with the deep fried turkey is a delicious tasting experience. Also try the Orange Crush cheese from Quebec.

There is more to discover as this boutique has fresh vegetables and fruit like figs from South Africa as well as pasta, baked goods, different cuts of beef (some aged more than 50 days), imported cookies, chocolate and other delights.

This boutique is not cheap but the value and taste that you get is well worth it. We will be regulars in the future. Also if you enjoy having a home meal of cheese, prosciutto, crackers and wine, you need to visit this emporium.

reviews.title: Used to be the best
text: Not any more.
The meat section has fallen away and anybody who is looking first class steaks at a reasonable price should look elsewhere.
Even the previously top of the line cheese section has  fallen away.
Supposedly a world class cheese could not be cut with a heavy duty cutter - obviously had been sitting somewhere for some time. It was the consistency and taste of masonry.
It is entirely possible that it has changed hands recently, most of the staff seem new.

reviews.title: THE BEST
text: This is a 10 Star cheese and gastronomic destination. If you go during the week, you may see some of the top chefs in Toronto shopping and chatting with Afrim, Cheese Sommelier extraordinaire.

reviews.title: All the stink but without the cut...
text: You like cheese but don’t like to cut it?
Then this place is for you!  All the stink, all the taste, and all the flavours.
Old, medium and mild...that’s just the staff!  Wait till you get to the variety of cheeses available.
More choices than your local Baskin Robbins.
Must visit if you’re into the old, stinky, hard and soft.  Regardless you’ll find the right one for you!!!

reviews.title: Hidden Pearl
text: I love doing grocery shopping with my partner here. This place carries the freshest products. Pastries are handmade fresh. So many different varieties of sauces, olive oils, jams and of course cheese. Staff are also amazing. I highly recommend to shop here if you are looking to impress someone with your cooking.

reviews.title: A gourmet's paradise
text: This store is like an Aladdin's cave of cheese, chocolates, pastries, oils, vinegars, and  - much more that a foodie would delight in.  It is a little expensive to buy regularly, but wonderful for an occasional treat.  I could have spent the whole day there.

reviews.title: Holy smokes smokes this place !!!
text: Wow! This place will be a must stop on any trip to Toronto in our future. We will be bringing cooler bags next time for sure.
The group of us had a very nice espresso as we walked in, which was quite lovely, and then the fun began!
This place has everything. Unbelievable:)
Left with some delicious cheese and a few other goodies:) the variety of filled doughnuts didn't last long however hahaha so incredible!
Fantastic spot❤️

reviews.title: Wonderful Variety of All Things Gourmet
text: The Cheese Boutique has certainly come a long way since the days of Bloor West Village! There's a terrific selection of oils & vinegars, sauces, rices, spices and obviously cheeses & other delicatessen-type items. They also have fresh produce and a meat section as well as a bakery counter. Just too many things to mention all of them.

If you're looking for obscure, hard to find ingredients then definitely check out this place. Chances are you'll most likely find what you need and then some. Prices are definitely inflated, just like most of these types of stores are, so be prepared for a more expensive grocery bill than usual. Not a lot of immediate parking but there are side streets all around.
I always enjoy stopping by and end up staying twice as long as I expected but I love this kind of foodie place and will continue going back.

reviews.title: our one stop shop for fine foods
text: Staffed by excellent passionate foodies, this boutique cheese, meat and pastry store satisfies every culinary delight. Afrim and his family have infused their passion for excellence into every item available . We've had dinners catered by their chef, and have always had rave reviews.

reviews.title: Amazing selection of fine cheeses and other gourmet foods
text: Visited the Cheese Boutique to meet the owner, Afrim Pristine.  I was certainly amazed at the vast selection of fine cheese from around the world and around the corner.  Despite the name being Cheese it has a fantastic selection of other gourmet foods; from fresh meats to house made sausages and burgers as well as baked goods and condiments of all kinds.
A must stop for sauces (Hot, BBQ, mustards, etc)
The bakery is also a treat with fresh breads and desserts.
This is a special place,  with special service from special people!
P.S.  they have a store down the street that sells BBQ Grills, and Le Cruset cookware.

reviews.title: Our 1st Visit
text: Many thanks to our friends that recommended we go and see the Cheese Boutique for the variety and cheeses, bakery products, oils & sauces and much much more.  As soon as we walked in the door, we knew we would love the store.  We spent the first 15 to 20 + minutes just exploring the store to find so many things we love and many more that we wanted to try.

Rather than buy the types of cheese we love, we narrowed our selection to 4 cheeses we have never bought.  Our server gave us samples to help us refine our final 4 choices & reluctantly, we stopped there.  On our next visit we will try another group.
It was no surprise to see how fast our 1st choice disappeared when we got back to our boat and broke out our crackers and a bottle of wine to compliment the cheese.
In addition to the Cheese Boutique, they also have a kitchen store a few steps away and for those hungry explorers, the food truck and benches are there for you convenience.

reviews.title: Good selection of specialty foods
text: Finally made our way here after many aborted attempts.  Finally made it.  Good selection of specialty foods.  Certainly holds its own with similar shops in Kensington and St.Lawrence Markets.  Was a little disappointed, but this had more to do with my expectations (hype from other customers) than what the shop had offered.  Was impressed that they had Iberian ham (first time I’ve noticed it in a shop here).  Would certainly come back again if I found myself in the area.

reviews.title: Amazing Amazing Amazing
text: A wonderful selection of cheeses like no other in Toronto area.  The bakery, meats and other products complement the cheese selections.
If you've never been here, go soon!!!

reviews.title: Always worth a visit!
text: Cheese and deli selection way beyond other places. Don't miss the cheese vault!  Tremendous high end butcher. Also good bakery takeout. Just a great food experience, run by a great family.  It's been my go-to place since the 1970s!

reviews.title: OMFG!
text: How did I not know about this place??! If you're a lover of cheese and meat go here...now!  Try the prosciutto chips...  soooo freakin good!!!

reviews.title: Amazing!!
text: I am a cheese lover and often go to special cheese stores to get high quality cheese with excellent variety.  The service by number was fast and the employee realizing I knew a thing or two of cheese told another employee he will be longer so we wouldn't feel rushed.  He took the time to really get into cheeses we may like.  I only walked out with $150 worth as we were with others and had to leave but amazing place.  I think Ben Affleck has forgotten his cheese hanging in the cheese vault.  You must visit the cheese vault while there.  Oh and they have these donuts filled with heaven. No other way to describe them, freshly made at the front.  Stop and grab 6.

reviews.title: Fabulous selection at ridiculous prices
text: I ran across the Cheese Boutique during a search for places to visit on my recent trip to Toronto.  I must admit that the range of products available here is very impressive.  The prices for me however were mind-blowing.  I didn't leave empty handed however.  A half pound of cheese, a box of crackers, 100g of Spanish olives and one cupcake set me back $23.  I don't envision returning here anytime soon.

reviews.title: Delicious!
text: Found this place on trip advisor & wanted to visit. Wow! We walked in to food heaven - wish we lived near by! Bought a couple of cheeses to take home (to U.K.!), lunch for 3 of us (2 Deli sandwiches & Mac Cheese - delicious!) plus amazing desserts. It wasn't cheap but it was absolutely gorgeous.

reviews.title: Worthwhile for food lovers
text: If you like food, this place is for you.  As you would expect from the name there are many many different cheeses as well as meat, condiments, tasty treats and pretty well anything else you can imagine.
